rmi.tree

Class RMITreeNodeImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • rmi.tree.RMITreeNodeImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, RMITreeNode

    public class RMITreeNodeImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements RMITreeNode
    An implementation of the RMITreeNode interface. Has one father, an array of children, a trace of the propogation and a name to make it easier to understand.
    Author:
    cachera brabant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RMITreeNodeImpl

        public RMITreeNodeImpl(java.lang.String name,
               RMITreeNode father)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Initialize a RMITreeNodeImpl with the father father and no child. If the RMITreeNodeImpl is a root, father can be set to null.
        Parameters:
        name - A name to make the trace easier to understand
        father - The father of the RMITreeNodeImpl. If it's null, the RMITreeNodeImpl is a root.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • propagate

        public java.lang.String propagate(byte[] data)
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: RMITreeNode
        Give data as an array of byte to the RMITreeNode in order to propagate to the leaves of the tree.
        Specified by:

      • sendDataToChildren

        public java.lang.String sendDataToChildren(byte[] data)
                                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: RMITreeNode
        Send data as an array of byte to every children of the RMITreeNode. If the node is a leaf, put the message in the trace.
        Specified by:
        sendDataToChildren in interface RMITreeNode
        Parameters:
        data - An array of byte containing the data to send to the children.
        Returns:
        The trace of the children receiving the data.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
